item.title: Hypothesis Testing
item.description: Hypothesis Testing Outline Assumptions Stating hypothesis Test statistics and its null distribution P-value and its intepretation Conclusion Step1: Assumptions For proportion The variable measured is categorical. The data are obtained using randomization. The sample size n is sufficiently large that the sampling distribution of the sample proportion $\hat{p}$ is approximately Normal when the null is true. (This will be true if n⋅p0⋅(1 − p0) ≥ 5, where p0 is the value specified in H0.
